attributes.action: Stop the proposed huge rail linked distribution park, with road to rail transfer facilities and associated business development being proposed on open countryside near Junction 8 of the M20 in Kent.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This huge development includes 382,000 sq metres of warehousing, plus associated rail sidings and road infrastructure, covering open countryside, and will operate 24hours a day, increasing traffic on the already congested M20 and associated local roads. The M20 is frequently closed in this area due to accidents, and the entire local road network around Maidstone and surrounding villages grinds to a halt. Why bring the lorries all the way to Maidstone? Surely the environmently friendly way is to locate this interchange nearer to the port of entry. Please support us, and sign our petition

rejection.details: The petition is similar to http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/RailPort/ Please consider signing this before opening a new petition.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
